notes.Jamie: I think I could get into this more if I played it with those who knew the rules.  Bit steeper curve than I originally thought coming from King of Tokyo.
Doesn't make for a very entertaining 2 player game, but would like to see how it plays with 4

title: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

notes.Jamie: It's not a bad game by any means, but to me there is a bit of RNG as to if I'll enjoy it based on what decks are pulled
I was honestly disappointed, maybe with the right group it'd be worth revisiting? But I think there are better games in this category.
It was interesting, but I don't see much replayability.  A decent bluffing game, but I think there are better out there.
More bluffing, better atmosphere than Skull, but still relatively limited replayability.  Might be worth getting on a super sale.
This might be too similar to Cards Against Humanity. (All be it, a bit more kid friendly, so maybe? But I'd list this as a lower priority purchase)
